data.title: Always something new
data.text: They are always having different artist promotions, they have meet and greet nights, they also mix with other Venus to use the court yard!

data.title: Neat
data.text: My wife and I went because I had never been to any Art Museum. I enjoyed the different exhibits. If you are like me and have never been to an Art Museum, go! You will be glad you did.

data.title: Currently moving exhibits
data.text: The pieces in the museum were unique.  Most of the place was closed as exhibits were being replaced.  The little bit we saw was neat, we enjoyed the AC.  There were activities upstairs for children the day we visited.

data.title: Cool stop in Dothan (free admission)
data.text:
I personally have no interest in art how ever my 8 year old daughter loves art and enjoys art museums. My rating will be on the establishment and not necessarily the art inside. 

The museum was clean and well maintained. We were greeted when we came in by a lady who was polite helpful and  knowledgeable about the exhibits. Many of the other art museums we had visited had a children's area where they can paint and draw this one did not have one open at the time we were there and it was some what small these are the reasons I gave it 4 instead of 5 stars. My daughter enjoyed looking at the paintings and we were glad to have stopped on our way through Dothan.

data.title: nice visit
data.text: The reclaimed building is a great use for this museum.  The exhibits were interesting and had nice variety.

data.title: great town
data.text:
at the sugestion of the hotel we stayed aat we came and he was a great sugestion 
lots to see nice people very imformative loved the murals we were able to see

data.title: A Treasure for All Who Enter
data.text: First, there is no entrance fee, merely a donations box. The exhibits are wonderful, changing, timely yet historic. The staff always smiles and helps if needed. I've seen everything from children's art to rare quilts. Once is definitely not enough to visit this true gem in such a rural community.

data.title: Super local museum
data.text: i found the building as interesting as the art.  the museum would be a great rainy day outing for anyone.

data.title: Grandmother
data.text: What a surprise!  This museum is housed in the original historic power generating building.... beautifully restored on several levels with high ceilings and hand hewn beams.  The museum collection focuses on contemporary American Art, with special emphasis on Alabama artists. It is an asset forDothan and well worth a visit'

data.title: Really enjoyed the classical guitar event recently
data.text: We got to see a local celebrity of sorts in Dr Andrew Stroud when he played at the WMA on Sept 17, 2015. We have been to many events they've put on out there, but this was by far one of the most memorable. My wife and I are so glad there are more things like this to go and see now. Great job!

data.title: Diamond in the rough
data.text: The museum brings a lot of neat art to the local community.  Memberships are not expensive.  Help support the ARTS.

data.title: Child-friendly
data.text: The small staff (receptionist and security guard) were very friendly and helpful.  The facility is clean, well-maintained, and (among others) houses some works of several regionally-known artists.  This museum also apparently partners with local educators to encourage an increased interest in the arts by elementary-age children.  It is commendable that the Wiregrass area funds and supports this museum.  My major suggestion for improvement would be to solicit, and display, some works of a more diverse group of artists.  There's nothing wrong with what they are doing, but I believe they could significantly increase their patronage by expanding the museum's artistic breadth and depth.  They certainly have plenty of room in which they could place an expanded collection.

data.title: Awesome, especially the "Art After Hours" events!
data.text:
I've been to the Wiregrass Museum of Art probably three or four times now, but it wasn't until last week that I attended their "Art After Hours" event. I'm not positive, but I think these events happen quarterly and I'm not positive if this occurs every time, but the one we attended happened to coincide with the initial night of exhibition for artist Dale Kennington. It was amazing, and I can't say enough about it!

First of all, her artwork is just amazing. Realistic art is my favorite, so it was a hit with me. I have no words to describe it... if you are reading this post and can get to the museum before 9/26/15, when the exhibit closes, then do so!

The Art After Hours event was only $5 to get in to. They served wine and beer and other refreshments and you could walk around (most parts of the museum) with your beverage and take in the art.

Everyone at the museum was super nice, none more so than the awesome security guard they had on staff posted outside one of the art exhibit rooms. I know it's probably odd to mention the security guard, but I'm telling you, he was the nicest guy and he helped add to our positive experience. (Although it was a repeat visit for me to the museum, it was my fiance's first time here. He said it was his first time at an art museum, EVER? The verdict is...he LOVED it! <and not just because he could have beer this night!>)

Anyway, an enjoyable place for all, whether it's an "Art After Hours" or just a regular day at the museum. This place should not be missed if you are in the area!

data.title: Great cultural spot
data.text: This art gallery has a wide variety of mediums. There are sections geared towards children. A lovely gift shop.

data.title: stimulating
data.text:
This small museum is always stimulating.  Even the exhibits I don't understand are interesting and I learn something from every one.
My grandchildren loved coming here when they were small, because the museum has a great place for little ones to learn about art and themselves.

data.title: Amazing
data.text: This is a gem in this small SE Alabama town. Located in Downtown Dothan across from the Civic Center.

data.title: Great Little Museum in Downtown Dothan
data.text: This is a small, but charming museum in a historic building in downtown Dothan. It has at least four exhibition spaces and the museum keeps constantly revolving shows going. Upstairs is a kids museum which is great for young children. I used to bring mine here on a rainy day to keep them occupied. They have several different stations that my children thought were fantastic. There's also a small gift shop. In addition, they sometimes highlight local artwork from area schools. It's been a little while since I've been there to view an exhibition, but I don't believe they have a specific admission price, they just ask for a donation. You can also become a member. It's also a nice setting for an elegant party - they rent it out for that purpose. It's only steps from the World's Smallest City Block - so kill two birds with one stone and visit both sites while here. If you go during the day there are several places where you can eat lunch or picnic. Makes for a nice, inexpensive afternoon.
